items.title: Thesis - The Monopoly Effect
items.text: The Monopoly Effect is a philosophical and scientific framework that examines how competitive, individualistic, and monopolistic socio-economic systems shape human behavior - and influence the long-term survivability of our species on Earth.

items.title: The Monopoly Effect
items.text: The Monopoly Effect learning journey is an invitation to see clearly, to think responsibly, and to participate consciously in shaping the conditions under which human life can continue to develop rather than fracture, creating a flourishing and joyful future for our species.

items.title: The Harmony Quest
items.text: This quest invites a shared commitment to shaping a future in which Humanism guides progress toward coherence, care, and lasting flourishing. Join us on this learning journey to engage in a world with greater clarity, responsibility, joy and purpose.

items.title: Talks, Keynotes and Roundtables
items.text: Focus: The Monopoly Effect & CIM-Systems • Natural Human Habitat & Education • Identifications & Suffering • Neurophilosophy & Ethics • Core Theory of Development • Intergenerational Justice and Resources.
